players

Class ComputerPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • players.Player
      • players.ComputerPlayer

  • public class ComputerPlayer
extends Player
    This class represents a player simulated by the computer.
    Version:
    1.0.10
    Author:
    BRUCELLA2

      • resultsListMoreLess

        private List<String> resultsListMoreLess
        List of results obtained by comparing the proposed numbers with the mystery number in More Less game.

        The items in the list are Strings (usually a result of the comparison).
        See Also:
        getResultsListMoreLess(), setResultsListMoreLess(List)

      • getResultsListMoreLess

        public List<String> getResultsListMoreLess()

        The list items are in the form of String.
        Returns:
        the list of proposed results in MoreLess game
        See Also:
        setListNumberProposed(List), addResultatMoreLess(String)

      • setListNumberProposed

        public void setListNumberProposed(List<List<Integer>> pListNumberProposed)
        Allows to define the list of numbers already proposed.

        To add an item to the list you must use addLastProposition(List)
        Parameters:
        pListNumberProposed - the list of numbers already proposed
        See Also:
        getListNumberProposed(), addLastProposition(List)

      • setResultsListMoreLess

        public void setResultsListMoreLess(List<String> pResultsListMoreLess)
        Allows to define the list of results obtained by comparing the proposed number with the mystery number in MoreLess game .

        To add an item to the list you must use addResultatMoreLess(String)
        Parameters:
        pResultsListMoreLess - The list of results obtained in MoreLess game
        See Also:
        getResultsListMoreLess(), addResultatMoreLess(String)

      • addBadResultMastermind

        public void addBadResultMastermind(List<Integer> pProposition,
                                   int pBadPos)
        Add a proposition and the number of digits in bad position to the map resultsBadPos
        Parameters:
        pProposition - The number proposed
        pBadPos - The number of digits in bad position

      • addGoodResultMastermind

        public void addGoodResultMastermind(List<Integer> pProposition,
                                    int pGoodPos)
        Add a proposition and the number of digits in good position to the map resultsGoodPos
        Parameters:
        pProposition - The number proposed
        pGoodPos - The number of digits in good position

      • addLastProposition

        private void addLastProposition(List<Integer> pLastProposition)
        This method allows to add the number proposed in the last proposal to the list of results.

        A proposal is an ArrayList of the integer. This method is used internally by giveNumber(int)
        Parameters:
        pLastProposition - number proposed in the last proposal

      • addResultatMoreLess

        public void addResultatMoreLess(String pResultMoreLess)
        This method allows to add a result to the results list.

        A result is a string obtained when comparing a proposed number with the mystery number in MoreLess game.
        Parameters:
        pResultMoreLess - Result of the comparison between a proposed number and the mystery number in MoreLess game

      • createPool

        private void createPool(List<List<Integer>> pPool,
                        int nbDigitCombination)
        This method creates a pool of combinations.

        The creation need a pool with at min one element. All permutation based on this element(s) will populate the pool given in pattern.
        Max value for each digit is defined in the config.properties CombineGame.getNbColors()
        Parameters:
        pPool - Initial pool with one element minimum and that will be populate with all the combinations.
        nbDigitCombination - Number of digit constituting a combination

      • giveNumber

        public List<Integer> giveNumber(int pMaxValueDigit)
        This method enables to the ComputerPlayer to provide a number in the form of an ArrayList of integer.

        This number is added to the list of proposed numbers.
        Specified by:
        giveNumber in class Player
        Parameters:
        pMaxValueDigit - The max value digit
        Returns:
        A number in the form of an ArrayList of integer

      • giveNumberPattern

        public List<Integer> giveNumberPattern()
        This method enables to the ComputerPlayer to provide a number pattern in the form of an ArrayList of integer.

        This number is chose in a pool of possible combinations. This pool is updated before the number is chose based on the precedent proposition and result (good position / bad position)
        Returns:
        A number in the form of an ArrayList of integer
        See Also:
        createPool(List, int), optimizedPool(List)

      • optimizedPool

        private void optimizedPool(List<List<Integer>> pPool)
        This method optimized the pool of combinations.

        Based on previous propositions and results, keep only combinations that are compatible with the results previously obtained.
        Parameters:
        pPool - The pool of combinations that will be optimized
